Articles.Content:
This (correct me if I'm wrong) update brought the need connect non-manned craft to Kerbin via satellite networks. If you you check the info on your craft it will tell you what the first thing said craft connects to. I noticed my craft in the orbit of Kerbin connects to locations with names! From my knowledge the Inland KSC center is "Kerbin: Baikerbanur" which I have visited and planted a flag on. Another is I think "Crater Rim" which I have also visited. Does anyone know the exact locations of the rest of the rest? As I am typing I have just connected to Mesa South. There is also Harvester Massif, which seems to be very south. Or north. I have then connected to Nye Island. Thats all I can seem to find in the orbit this spacecraft is in. Anymore? And I still don't know where all the others are!

Edited December 16, 2016 by Spacetraindriver

4 hours ago, Spacetraindriver said:

This (correct me if I'm wrong) update brought the need connect non-manned craft to Kerbin via satellite networks. If you you check the info on your craft it will tell you what the first thing said craft connects to. I noticed my craft in the orbit of Kerbin connects to locations with names! From my knowledge the Inland KSC center is "Kerbin: Baikerbanur" which I have visited and planted a flag on. Another is I think "Crater Rim" which I have also visited. Does anyone know the exact locations of the rest of the rest? As I am typing I have just connected to Mesa South. There is also Harvester Massif, which seems to be very south. Or north. I have then connected to Nye Island. Thats all I can seem to find in the orbit this spacecraft is in. Anymore? And I still don't know where all the others are!

Deploy a KerbNet satellite with anomaly detection and you'll be able to find others.

If you use the ScanSat mod, you'll have them marked on the ScanSat map of Kerbin.

Or just set CommNet visualization to "Network" or "VesselLinks" and it will show you all the station the craft can connect to. Thats how i would do it...

I think there are 5 station roughly on the equator (like the KSC2 one), one north and one south.

@Spacetraindriver "I noticed my craft in orbit of Kerbin connects..."

Can I have the craft file of the launch vehicle you used to put a train into orbit?

Edited December 20, 2016 by MitchS

3 minutes ago, MitchS said:

@Spacetraindriver "I noticed my craft in orbit of Kerbin connects..."

Can I have the craft file of the launch vehicle you used to put a train into orbit?

Unfortunately this update Gene decided we get the basics of space flight down before we send trains into space.

Edited December 20, 2016 by Spacetraindriver
